title: Ticket #5712: Add examples of case-sensitive string comparison
description:
Section 4.1 of the manual says that == and != are case-insensitive but ? and ! are case-sensitive. However, you have to be looking for it to find it.

The incoming patch adds explicit string comparison examples to the tables and some additional text in the description to help make it more obvious.
remarks:
2016-Jun-08 09:05:40 by wenger:
I incorporated Ben's patch (with a little bit of cleanup), so I'm going to resolve this ticket. (Thanks for the patch, Ben!)
